1: <sup>1</sup> O God, thou hast cast us off, thou hast scattered us, thou hast been displeased; O turn thyself to us again.
2: <sup>2</sup> Thou hast made the earth to tremble; thou hast broken it: heal the breaches thereof; for it shaketh.
3: <sup>3</sup> Thou hast shewed thy people hard things: thou hast made us to drink the wine of astonishment.
4: <sup>4</sup> Thou hast given a banner to them that fear thee, that it may be displayed because of the truth. Selah.
5: <sup>5</sup> That thy beloved may be delivered; save with thy right hand, and hear me.
6: <sup>6</sup> God hath spoken in his holiness; I will rejoice, I will divide Shechem, and mete out the valley of Succoth.
7: <sup>7</sup> Gilead is mine, and Manasseh is mine; Ephraim also is the strength of mine head; Judah is my lawgiver;
8: <sup>8</sup> Moab is my washpot; over Edom will I cast out my shoe: Philistia, triumph thou because of me.
9: <sup>9</sup> Who will bring me into the strong city? who will lead me into Edom?
10: <sup>10</sup> Wilt not thou, O God, which hadst cast us off? and thou, O God, which didst not go out with our armies?
11: <sup>11</sup> Give us help from trouble: for vain is the help of man.
12: <sup>12</sup> Through God we shall do valiantly: for he it is that shall tread down our enemies.
